intro: Perezia alamanii, commonly known as the Alamanii bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and compact growth habit.
